Title: Webmaster
Job_Description:
About Talroo
We are honored to be recognized as a multi-award-winning organization. Talroo has been consistently recognized as a Top Workplace and a Best Place to Work in Austin. We've been ranked the last five years by Inc. 500/5000 as one of the fastest growing companies in the U.S. You'll also find us on the Austin Business Journal's Fast 50 growth awards list multiple times. We're growing the right way, and we need exceptional talent to help us build upon our successful story.
Talroo is helping organizations like Uber, McDonald's, UPS, The Home Depot, Target and more, find and hire their essential workforces. Our data-driven job and hiring event recruiting platform turns the Internet into a help wanted sign. Our pay-for-performance model enables customers to maximize efficiency, not waste spend, and hire employees faster than they could with any of our competitors.

Rather than drive customers to a destination site, Talroo uses a consumer marketing approach to deliver job opportunities to candidates where they are already spending time online. Similar to what Google AdSense and Facebook Ad Networks do for their advertisers, Talroo uncovers the right candidates that companies are looking to hire.

Talroo leverages a search-and-match algorithm powered by state-of-the-art AI technologies. Our deep-learning processes analyze billions of signals daily, assessing the job seeker-employer relationship in real time. This produces significantly better search results for the job seekers, and higher quality applicant matches for the employer.

Title: Senior UX Designer
Job_Description:
THRIVE is an award-winning, ISO 9001 certified end-to-end product development and innovation strategy firm. Our company is built on Informed Design — an empathy-driven, human-centered approach that helps us and our clients design, develop, and engineer products that have real meaning and experiences that people love. You can find our innovations positively impacting lives in homes, hospitals, and businesses around the world. This is why THRIVE continues to be a trusted advisor to some of the world's most iconic brands, including AT&T, Amazon, Amgen, Becton Dickinson, Coca-Cola, Keurig, Hillrom, Intuitive Surgical, Johnson & Johnson, McDonald's, Samsung, Wolf, and SC Johnson. Now, we're looking to add even more talent to our awesome team!

Hello, we're THRIVE

Title: Accounting Manager - Hybrid
Job_Description:
Position Summary:

This position will utilize strong accounting, financial reporting, planning and analytical skills to support Distribution Center, Regional and US Operations. The Accounting Manager will manage the month-end close process, prepare financial reports, and be involved in planning and forecasting functions, as well as provide analytical support for key initiatives and ad hoc requests. It is expected that the individual in this role demonstrate a true business partnership with all levels of leadership, this includes but is not limited to Distribution Center, Division and Senior Leadership. This position may or may not have direct report / people leadership responsibilities as assigned to support the business

Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:
Prepare month-end close function for multiple distribution centers including preparation of financial / operational reports, expense / inventory variance analysis, balance sheet account reconciliation

Title: Accounting Manager - Hybrid
Job_Description:
Little Caesars hires highly motivated, friendly, trustworthy and reliable individuals for part-time crew positions. Previous restaurant or pizza experience preferred but not required.
Apply at https://www.snagajob.com/job-search/w-37874/q-little+caesars?radius=5
JOB SUMMARY: Crew Members work productively as part of the restaurant team and performs job responsibilities in such a way that all the products made are of high quality and the customers served are satisfied.
Crew Members receive direction from the restaurant management team and Little Caesars training materials to effectively perform their job. Crew Members will practice the established procedures and use the proper tools associated with taking and preparing customer orders. All Crew Members must be proficient at each work station and be able to work in different stations at any given time. Crew Members need to work in cooperation with other Crew Members and management to achieve restaurant goals,

Title: Accounting Manager - Hybrid
Job_Description:
Company Description

McDonald’s new growth strategy, Accelerating the Arches, encompasses all aspects of our business as the leading global omni-channel restaurant brand. As the consumer landscape shifts we are using our competitive advantages to further strengthen our brand. One of our core growth strategies is to Double Down on the 3Ds (Delivery, Digital and Drive Thru). McDonald’s will accelerate technology innovation so 65M+ customers a day will experience a fast, easy experience, whether at one of our 25,000 and growing Drive Thrus, through McDelivery, dine-in or takeaway.
Leading this tech revolution is McDonald’s Global Technology organization made up of intrapreneurs who get to build really cool tech with scary smart people using the latest innovations like AI, IOT, and edge computing. We do this working along diverse, global teams who are always hungry for a challenge. It’s bonus points when you get to see your family and friends use the tech you build at their favorite McD restaurant.

Title: Accounting Manager - Hybrid
Job_Description:
UpKeep is the leading cloud-based Asset Operations Management software developed to revolutionize the way teams manage facilities and maintenance work. We provide mobile-first SaaS solutions, Industrial IoT sensors, data analytics tools, advanced enterprise integrations, and top-notch professional services. Our innovative technology is modernizing workflows and maximizing operational efficiency for over 3,000 customers including Shell, Yamaha, Unilever, McDonalds, Subway, Pepsi, and Marriott!
We're a Series B tech startup with 100+ team members across the US. We've been recognized as a* "Best Place to Work"* multiple years in a row by fostering an inclusive and mission-driven culture. In addition to stock options and great benefits, our people have the flexibility to work remote. UpKeep is ranked the #1 Facility Management software on Gartner, #1 Maintenance Management software on G2 Crowd, FrontRunners on Software Advice, and CMMS Leader on IDC MarketScape.

Title: Accounting Manager - Hybrid

Refer A Friend
Company Description

McDonald’s is proud to be one of the most recognized brands in the world, with restaurants in over 100 countries that serve 70 million customers daily. As the global leader in the food service industry, our legacy of innovation and hard work continues to drive us.
From drive thru updates to delivery to mobile order and pay, we are innovating quickly and growing. Joining McDonald's means thinking big and preparing for a career that can have influence around the world.
At McDonald’s, we see every day as a chance to create positive impact. We lead through our values centered on inclusivity, service, integrity, community and family. From support of Ronald McDonald House Charities to our Youth Opportunity project and sustainability initiatives, our values keep us dedicated to using our scale for good: good for our customers, people, industry and planet. We also offer outstanding benefits including a sabbatical program, tuition assistance and flexible work arrangements.

Company_Name: ['Defense Health Agency Civilian Corps, Falls Church, VA', '3.8']
Title: Accounting Manager - Hybrid
Job_Description:
Overview:
This vacancy in located at Fort Eustis, Virginia

Fort Eustis, located in Newport News, Virginia, was established in 1918, and has served a number of purposes, including an Army training facility for artillery and artillery observation, a prison and a work camp. Beginning in the World War II era, the primary mission of Fort Eustis has been Army transportation training, research and development, engineering, and operations, including aviation and marine shipping activities. The base in located near Williamsburg and Virginia Beach, Virginia.
Responsibilities:
The primary purpose of this position is: To serve as the facility Information Technology (IT) Systems Administrator and Chief Medical Information Officer (CMIO) for Information Management Division (IMD) in the Defense Health Agency (DHA), McDonald Army Health Center (MCAHC), Veterinary Command (VETCOM), and Dental Command (DENCOM), Joint Base Langley Eustis (JBLE), Virginia and its supported clinics, buildings and the Military Treatment Facility (MTF).








Qualifications:

Title: Application Architect
Job_Description:
AM Technical Solutions- Who Are We:
AM Technical Solutions (AM), founded in 1994, is a proven and licensed architecture, engineering, and construction firm bringing innovative solutions to the Biopharma industry to help in the fight to save lives. Our knowledge and expertise in high-tech spaces combined with our culture-first mentality allows our team to deliver the entire scope of work for high-tech construction projects on schedule, on budget, and at the level of quality required by customers. AM Life Science being an integrated part of AM Technical Solutions brings new energy and ideas to an ever-changing industry. Our team is comprised of motivated, intelligent, capable and qualified individuals who design, execute and manage projects and programs that implement risk-based approaches utilizing scientific data and justifications to align with the regulatory and industry standards. AM Life Science takes pride in our accuracy, efficiency, and integrity, which translates into cost and time savings for our Clients.

Job Title:
Facilities/Utilities/Project Engineer (cGMP – Pharmaceutical)


Massachusetts

Position Description

AM Technical Solutions is looking for a Senior Utilities Engineer to work with a pharmaceutical client in the Boston, MA area. This candidate will be responsible for overseeing utility system installation; participating in start-up, commissioning and qualification for a new building project. Ideal candidates should have strong experience with clean and plant utility systems including but not limited to WFI, Clean Steam, HVAC, and other related utility systems.

AMTS has opportunities throughout the country and overseas supporting multiple locations in MA, NH, RI, NC, Europe, and other locations.


Assist in the generation of a field commissioning and qualification execution schedule to minimize resources required, integrate with construction schedules and maximize system turnover efficiency.
Develop and peer review commissioning and qualification test protocols and summary reports.
Work with the Construction Manager to appropriately sequence the turnover of systems to commence commissioning activities, including coordination of the close out of punch list items.
Coordinate system completion walk-downs.
Train in qualified document system(s) for document control of qualification protocols, change controls and functional specification documents.
Support generation of inspection and test plans for equipment, including approach to integrated FATs and leveraging of testing.
Execute Commissioning and Verification as well as support daily construction activities.
Coordinate with site engineering department to schedule utility system shutdowns, tie-ins and system startup.
Help to develop predictive and preventative maintenance program for site utility systems.
Participate in equipment submittal reviews to help ensure compliance with Project contract documents.
Support all commissioning and qualification activities on the project.
Review turnover packages and ensure that the documentation is accurate and complete and meets specifications.


Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering or related discipline.
7+ years’ of relevant experience including similar positions on large capital projects.
Must have experience with leading mid-to-large capital projects for the pharmaceutical industry.
Knowledge of production support and building utility systems including, but not limit to, WFI, Clean Steam, Process Gases, HVAC, Plant Steam and Pumped Return Condensate, Process Liquid Waste, Process Chillers, Cooling Towers, and associated operating systems (PLC and BAS/BMS).
Experience in new facility start-up, large scale equipment package vendor management, and FAT execution and coordination.

Job Summary:
The General Manager is a polished well-spoken and well-regarded ambassador who carries a strong vision for their hotel. He or she is charged with responsibility for all aspects of operations for their assigned property; providing support supervision and guidance to their management team and front line associates. He or she will ensure that financial performance is optimized that high quality product and service levels are maintained and that the hotel is operated in compliance with state federal and local regulations as well as Company and brand standards.

The General Manager will establish priorities and lead key operational initiatives such as the sales plan and budget development and execution of physical property improvement projects. They will provide hands on leadership to ensure that revenue is maximized while expenses are effectively controlled. They will serve as the linchpin for communications with guests and clients associates ownership corporate representatives brand representatives and key vendors.

Company_Name: ['Defense Health Agency Civilian Corps, Falls Church, VA', '3.8']
Title: Supervisory IT Specialist (SYSADMIN) GS-2210-12
Job_Description:
Overview:
This vacancy in located at Fort Eustis, Virginia

Fort Eustis, located in Newport News, Virginia, was established in 1918, and has served a number of purposes, including an Army training facility for artillery and artillery observation, a prison and a work camp. Beginning in the World War II era, the primary mission of Fort Eustis has been Army transportation training, research and development, engineering, and operations, including aviation and marine shipping activities. The base in located near Williamsburg and Virginia Beach, Virginia.
Responsibilities:
The primary purpose of this position is: To serve as the facility Information Technology (IT) Systems Administrator and Chief Medical Information Officer (CMIO) for Information Management Division (IMD) in the Defense Health Agency (DHA), McDonald Army Health Center (MCAHC), Veterinary Command (VETCOM), and Dental Command (DENCOM), Joint Base Langley Eustis (JBLE), Virginia and its supported clinics, buildings and the Military Treatment Facility (MTF).








Qualifications:

Title: Facilities/Utilities Project Engineer (cGMP – Pharmaceutical)
Job_Description:
AM Technical Solutions- Who Are We:
AM Technical Solutions (AM), founded in 1994, is a proven and licensed architecture, engineering, and construction firm bringing innovative solutions to the Biopharma industry to help in the fight to save lives. Our knowledge and expertise in high-tech spaces combined with our culture-first mentality allows our team to deliver the entire scope of work for high-tech construction projects on schedule, on budget, and at the level of quality required by customers. AM Life Science being an integrated part of AM Technical Solutions brings new energy and ideas to an ever-changing industry. Our team is comprised of motivated, intelligent, capable and qualified individuals who design, execute and manage projects and programs that implement risk-based approaches utilizing scientific data and justifications to align with the regulatory and industry standards. AM Life Science takes pride in our accuracy, efficiency, and integrity, which translates into cost and time savings for our Clients.

Job Title:
Facilities/Utilities/Project Engineer (cGMP – Pharmaceutical)


Massachusetts

Position Description

AM Technical Solutions is looking for a Senior Utilities Engineer to work with a pharmaceutical client in the Boston, MA area. This candidate will be responsible for overseeing utility system installation; participating in start-up, commissioning and qualification for a new building project. Ideal candidates should have strong experience with clean and plant utility systems including but not limited to WFI, Clean Steam, HVAC, and other related utility systems.

AMTS has opportunities throughout the country and overseas supporting multiple locations in MA, NH, RI, NC, Europe, and other locations.


Assist in the generation of a field commissioning and qualification execution schedule to minimize resources required, integrate with construction schedules and maximize system turnover efficiency.
Develop and peer review commissioning and qualification test protocols and summary reports.
Work with the Construction Manager to appropriately sequence the turnover of systems to commence commissioning activities, including coordination of the close out of punch list items.
Coordinate system completion walk-downs.
Train in qualified document system(s) for document control of qualification protocols, change controls and functional specification documents.
Support generation of inspection and test plans for equipment, including approach to integrated FATs and leveraging of testing.
Execute Commissioning and Verification as well as support daily construction activities.
Coordinate with site engineering department to schedule utility system shutdowns, tie-ins and system startup.
Help to develop predictive and preventative maintenance program for site utility systems.
Participate in equipment submittal reviews to help ensure compliance with Project contract documents.
Support all commissioning and qualification activities on the project.
Review turnover packages and ensure that the documentation is accurate and complete and meets specifications.


Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering or related discipline.
7+ years’ of relevant experience including similar positions on large capital projects.
Must have experience with leading mid-to-large capital projects for the pharmaceutical industry.
Knowledge of production support and building utility systems including, but not limit to, WFI, Clean Steam, Process Gases, HVAC, Plant Steam and Pumped Return Condensate, Process Liquid Waste, Process Chillers, Cooling Towers, and associated operating systems (PLC and BAS/BMS).
Experience in new facility start-up, large scale equipment package vendor management, and FAT execution and coordination.

Job_Description:
UpKeep is the leading cloud-based Asset Operations Management software developed to revolutionize the way teams manage facilities and maintenance work. We provide mobile-first SaaS solutions, Industrial IoT sensors, data analytics tools, advanced enterprise integrations, and top-notch professional services. Our innovative technology is modernizing workflows and maximizing operational efficiency for over 3,000 customers including Shell, Yamaha, Unilever, McDonalds, Subway, Pepsi, and Marriott!
We're a Series B tech startup with 100+ team members across the US. We've been recognized as a* "Best Place to Work"* multiple years in a row by fostering an inclusive and mission-driven culture. In addition to stock options and great benefits, our people have the flexibility to work remote. UpKeep is ranked the #1 Facility Management software on Gartner, #1 Maintenance Management software on G2 Crowd, FrontRunners on Software Advice, and CMMS Leader on IDC MarketScape.

Job Summary:
The General Manager is a polished well-spoken and well-regarded ambassador who carries a strong vision for their hotel. He or she is charged with responsibility for all aspects of operations for their assigned property; providing support supervision and guidance to their management team and front line associates. He or she will ensure that financial performance is optimized that high quality product and service levels are maintained and that the hotel is operated in compliance with state federal and local regulations as well as Company and brand standards.

The General Manager will establish priorities and lead key operational initiatives such as the sales plan and budget development and execution of physical property improvement projects. They will provide hands on leadership to ensure that revenue is maximized while expenses are effectively controlled. They will serve as the linchpin for communications with guests and clients associates ownership corporate representatives brand representatives and key vendors.

Job_Description:
Changing lives. One child at a time. One professional at a time.
Do you love working with children? Are you interested in making a difference in the lives of children and families affected by autism in your community? Are you interested in growing your skills to obtain your Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification?
Verbal Beginnings is a leading Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy provider serving children diagnosed with autism. We are looking for entry-level and experienced candidates to fill multiple needs in the Bridgeville and McDonald, PA areas. We provide extensive training to anyone interested in learning about ABA therapy and autism and have a passion for working with children!
Location & Schedule:

Title: ABA Behavior Technician/RBT (Part-Time)
Job_Description:
JOB
This is a professional Early Intervention (EI) Services position supervised by the MH/DS Deputy Administrator and/or MH/DS Administrator. Primary responsibility is the oversight of the Luzerne-Wyoming Counties Infant/Toddler Early Intervention Program. The position has the responsibility to work closely with the Office of Child Development and Early Learning's (OCDEL) Bureau of Early Intervention Services and Family Supports and Early Intervention Technical Assistance (EITA) to ensure that the County EI Program is operating within compliance of the State OCDEL and their regulations. The position is also required to provide guidance and assistance to the Luzerne-Wyoming Counties EI Service Coordination Unit and the Luzerne-Wyoming Counties EI Provider Network.The position requires working knowledge of the EI Pennsylvania Enterprise for Linking Information about Children Across Networks (PELICAN) Home and Community Services Information System (HCSIS) including the Learning Management System (LMS), the Data Warehouse System, and Docushare.The position also requires knowledge of the Office of Special Education Program (OSEP) and Center for Medicaid and Medicare Services (CMS) regulations and requirements.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
The Early Intervention Program Specialist will be responsible for the following areas: PELICAN (EI HCSIS)Authorize and unauthorized service in PELICANAccept case transfers from other counties and assign the case to the EI SC Unit Transfer a case to another countyWork with the local EI Provider Network and the local EI SC Unit to resolve billing issues that require corrections/deletions/additions of data in PELICANRun the Reserve to Encumbrance Report in PELICAN numerous times at the end of the fiscal year to ensure all services required to be authorized on July 1 of the new fiscal year are authorized Monthly data review in the Data Warehouse and Docushare reports to ensure accuracy. Infant/Toddler/Family (I/T/F) WaiverEnroll, dis-enroll, and recertify all eligible children in the EI I/T/F WaiverEnsure the activities for the end of the fiscal year process for EI I/T/F Waiver occur. This includes: ensuring all HCBS forms and recertification forms to close children in the EI Waiver have been processed; removing all closed files from the active waiver filing cabinet; refile the closed files with the inactive waiver files; and Create a new active "Waiver Enrollment" listCompliance MonitoringConduct Compliance Monitoring of the EI SC Unit annually. The Monitoring will include the review of SC staff credentials, clearances, certifications including county oversight of the PD Registry, review of case files and observation of service delivery. A summary of findings will be provided to the EI SC Unit Supervisor. Based on compliance results, develop a Corrective Action Plan (if necessary)Conduct Compliance Monitoring of the local EI Provider Network annually. The Monitoring will include the review of provider staff credentials, clearances, certifications including county oversight of the PD Registry, review of case files and observation of service delivery. Also, complete the locally developed Provider Performance Evaluation Report with input from the EI SC Unit. A summary of findings will be provided to the EI Provider (independent contractor or agency). Based on compliance results, develop a Corrective Action Plan (if necessary) Verification ProcessFacilitate the EI Verification Process which occurs every four (4) years. The process includes: providing all the written information to OCDEL in advance (county profile, data elements, updated policies and procedures, any other requested information); representing the local EI Infant/Toddler Program at the onsite Interview; review all files selected for Verification; schedule observations of service delivery by Verification Team participants; represent the local EI Infant/Toddler Program at the onsite entrance and exit meetings; work with the EI Regional Coordinator and EITA Consultant to develop activities for our local Quality Enhancement Plan (QEP) as a result of the Verification findings Quality Enhancement Plan (QEP)Develop an annual Quality Enhancement Plan with assistance and guidance from the Regional EI Coordinator and our EITA Consultant. The process includes identifying our program's strengths and needs; identifying outcomes and activities to achieve the outcomes; identifying persons responsible and target dates for completion. Validating the QEP requires providing information and backup documentation to the Regional EI CoordinatorTraining Expenditure ReportTrack the expenditures of the EI training grant for trainings/child find/public awareness/parent engagement and report the results to OCDEL Family SurveyWork with the EI SC Unit and the local EI Provider Network to maximize the rate of return on the annual family survey. The EI Program Specialist will disseminate materials to the EI SC Unit and the local EI Provider Network to share with families about the Family SurveyLocal Interagency Coordinating Council (LICC) Interagency AgreementDevelop an Annual LICC Interagency Agreement (IA) with the Lead Signatories to the LICC (the EI Preschool Program, Head Start, the Department of Health, and the Parent and Provider LICC Co-chairs). The LICC IA addresses our local child find/public awareness, the transition process and family enhancement activities and initiativesPolicies and ProceduresDevelop and update local EI policies and procedures to be in accordance with the State Office of Child Development and Early Learning's requirements and regulations LICC "About Babies and Children" (ABC) NewsletterDevelop and publish the EI LICC "ABC" Newsletter at least three (3) times per calendar year Child Find/Public AwarenessHost/facilitate/participate in a variety of activities/events for the purpose of educating the general public about EI supports and services and to identify all children eligible for our services, especially in existing underserved targeted areas Social Events to HostHost the Annual EI Holiday Parties (Pizza Party for Luzerne County and a Breakfast with Santa for Wyoming CountyHost the "Transition Begins at Two" events (Super Bounce in Luzerne County and McDonald's in Wyoming County)Host the Annual LICC Retreat (to discuss LICC accomplishments and identify new LICC goals)Trainings to FacilitateHost and assist with the facilitation of the Annual Mandated Training Day, to include the topics: Universal Health Procedures and Precautions; Cultural Competency; Mediation/Due Process and all other Procedural Safeguards; Fire Safety and Emergency Evacuation, Transition, Mandated Reporting and Confidentiality (HIPAA/FERPA)Respond to all training requests from the EI SC Unit, the local Provider Network and families in the EI SystemWork with our EITA Consultant and the EI Regional Coordinator to provide training for our local EI Network on all state identified training needs Meetings to FacilitateFacilitate EI Provider meetings (every other month, unless there is a more/less frequent need). The SC Unit is also invited to this meetingFacilitate EI LICC meetings (host two (2) "Welcome to the LICC" Meetings, held in the evening in September, at community locations in Luzerne and Wyoming Counties; daytime meetings at the County MH/DS office in November and March; host an Annual LICC Retreat in May)Facilitate LICC Transition and Child Find subcommittee meetings, at least every other month or more frequently, breaking in July and AugustProvide meeting minutes for all EI Provider meetings and LICC meetings and subcommittee meetings)Facilitate the EI Inclusion Committee meeting, at the MH/DS office every other monthShared facilitation of monthly EI Core Leadership Team Meetings to promote and sustain the Coaching Model of Service Delivery in Luzerne-Wyoming Counties.Involvement in Community Council/Committee MeetingsBe an active member on and participate in a variety of community councils/committee, such as: the Luzerne County Interagency Council; the Lower Luzerne County Interagency Council; the Wyoming County Interagency Council, HANDS of Wyoming County; Luzerne County Success by Six, the Intergenerational Coalition of NEPA; the Head Start Health Advisory Board; the Early Learning Resource Center (ELRC; and Plans of Safe Care (POSC); Nanticoke Family Center.Participation in State OCDEL MeetingsParticipate in all State OCDEL facilitated meetings, such as: The bi-monthly EI Leadership meetings; the bi-monthly State ICC meetings; and the twice annual EI Leadership Conferences (Spring and Fall). The EI Program Specialist will also be available to participate in any meeting in which the State OCDEL requests their attendanceContract Development and ManagementDevelop and manage EI Provider contracts. Implement strategies to address service gaps/unmet service needs. Work with new providers to develop contracts when appropriateAnnual Allocation ManagementMonitor the base funding allocation from the State OCDEL to determine if a request for additional funding is appropriate and justified. Submit re-allocation calculations when requested by the State OCDEL. Work with the fiscal officer on all allocation management Mediation/Due Process/Complaint ProcessHave knowledge of all requests for mediation and due process against the Luzerne-Wyoming Counties EI Infant/Toddler Program. The EI Program Specialist will be available to assist the family with the request, if the SC Unit is not able to meet their needReview all complaints that do not reach the level of mediation or due process. Maintain a written copy of the complaint. Review the complaint with the SC Unit and the EI ProviderProvide other related duties as may be required/assigned.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of the principles and practices of early intervention program planning and development as it relates to the implementation of direct services and operational proceduresKnowledge of modern basic management principles and practicesKnowledge of current social, economic, and health problems and resources as it relates to the field of early interventionKnowledge of the basic principles and methods involved in working with infants and toddlers who are socially maladjusted or who have physical or intellectual disabilitiesKnowledge of the structure, organization, and methods of public and private intellectual disability agencies and institutionsKnowledge of principles and methods applied to collecting, reviewing, analyzing, and interpreting statistical dataKnowledge of federal, state and county legislation, policies and procedures related to the early intervention delivery systemAbility to analyze and evaluate program plans and operations and make recommendations leading toward policy and method determinationAbility to aid in the development and coordination of early intervention program plansAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships with departmental staff and other agenciesAbility to make clear and pertinent statements, orally and in writing

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Applicants must meet one (or more) of the following method(s) to be considered for this vacancy: Seniority Promotion: Bidding employees within the designated seniority unit when collective bargaining unit obligation(s) have been met then the following recruitment methods may be used: Promotion Without ExaminationTransferReassignmentVoluntary DemotionReinstatementCivil Service ListsELIGIBILITY - ALL CANDIDATE{S): 1.) Meet the minimum experience and training (MET'S) required for this position: Two years of professional experience in the field of intellectual disabilities; and a bachelor's degree; or Any equivalent combination of experience and training2.) State Civil Service Commission Approved Additional Special Requirements: None3.) Be eligible for selection in accordance with merit system employment regulations4.) Be a resident of PennsylvaniaELIGIBILITY - COMPETITIVE PROMOTION WITHOUT EXAMINATION ONLY: CLASS RESTRICTIONS: 1.) Have held regular civil service status in the following classifications: Casework SupervisorSELECTION CRITERIA: 1.) Meet the minimum experience and training required for the job.2.) Meritorious Service, defined as: The absence of any discipline above the level of written reprimand during the 12 months preceding the closing date on the posting.The last due overall regular or probationary performance evaluation was higher than unsatisfactory.3.) Seniority, Defines: A minimum of twelve months in the next lower class(es) by the closing date of this posting 11/22/2022.APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS: 1.) Interested qualified applicants must submit all the requested materials as specified in the "How to Apply." Failure to comply with the above application requirements will eliminate you from consideration for this position. 2.) Additional information may be obtained by contacting: Charyl Nagy Human Resources Analyst, OHS 272-808-2832 Charyl.Nagy@Luzernecounty.org POSITION DETAILS: Full timeCivil Service Permanent Non-ExemptUnionJob Code: L0755Hours: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM (80 hours Biweekly)Pay Range: 39** YOU MUST HOLD CIVIL SERVICE STATUS IN ORDER TO APPLY FOR THIS POSTING **HOW TO APPLY: All EXTERNAL CANDIDATES must apply and submit an application via: https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/pabureau/jobs/3789517/county-intellectual-disabilities-program-specialist-1-local-government-luzern?keywords=program%20specialist&pagetype=jobOpportunitiesJobsIf you are contacted for an interview and need accommodations for the interview due to a disability, please advise the interviewer of the accommodations you require well in advance of the scheduled date.LUZERNE COUNTY IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY & AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER.
